content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the Julia code to solve this problem:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.year(x)*100 + Dates.month(x), df[:dt])
end
```
This function takes a DataFrame `df` as input and adds a new column `:ym` to it, where each value is the year and month of the corresponding value in `:dt`. The map function applies the anonymous function (the part inside the brackets) to every element of the column `:dt`, which extracts the year and month from the DateTime object using `Dates.year` and `Dates.month` functions, respectively, and then concatenates them into an integer format "yyyymm".
